question: Why is granite classified as a rock?

content.source_1: Granite is composed primarily of intergrown quartz, feldspar, and mica.
content.source_2: Quartz, feldspar, and mica are minerals commonly occurring in Earthâ€™s crust.
content.source_3: In geology, a rock is an aggregate of one or more minerals or mineraloids.
content.source_4: Minerals are naturally occurring, inorganic solids that exhibit an orderly crystalline structure.
content.source_5: Granite is a naturally occurring, inorganic solid with interlocking crystals throughout its coarse-grained texture.
content.source_6: Granite crystallizes slowly from magma deep underground, producing a phaneritic (coarse-crystalline) texture.
